attributes.action: Power pads, A needs met service for disabled children using continence products
attributes.additional_details:
All disabled children should be entitled to have the continence products they need, not what their NHS Trusts think they deserve. Having your continence needs met is a basic human right, no child should be told they can only have three nappies, four if they are doubly incontinent and five if they have a life limiting condition. We want the Government to ensure that all Trust across the country provide a "needs met service"
Other adults/children aren't limited on toilet rolls or underwear, Why should our children be?
